It's just me. Really?
author: Harley A.

description: Decided to make a quick stop at "Republic" Food & Bar to grab a bite after drinks at the Roof top. We grabbed salsa & pico de gallo and "Pollo Asado" burritos with everything on it. The chicken was grilled to perfection , very Juicy & tender and packed with flavor . Great place to stop for Mexican /American fusion fusion in downtown SF
author: Portia S.

description: Amazing food & friendly staff! The Mole Poblano Tacos are to die for!! - You cant go wrong...they have a nice selection of draft beers too :)
author: Gustavo G.

description: Went there for brunch.  The fruit was not fresh.  The burrito was bland and tasteless.  Eggs Cubana Benedict was average.  Service was really slow but waitstaff nice.
author: T D.

description: Every time I come here I am happy with the meal, the service, and the beer selection. $2 taco Wednesday's are a win.
author: John C.

description: Super delicious food, fabulous service! Spicy does mean spicy so be prepared. They also offer a mild version. Had to stick with tacos since I'm gluten free and the don't have the menu marked. Would definitely come back. This place is 5-yums!
author: Dina F.

description: Great food and location! I really enjoyed the chipotle chicken sandwich even though it was a bit small for what I paid for ($15). The staff is super friendly and they have a lot of beers on tap and tvs. The decor, though, doesn't seem to have an identity. I had no idea they served Mexican food until I looked at their menu which is amazing. I will be back but I hope the decor improves! Suggestion: add "Mexican food" to your awning!
author: luis m.

description: I always have a very pleasant experience going here for food or drinks. On one occasion the waiter was beyond helpful, knowledgeable, and overall some of the best service I've experienced - and I'm in the restaurant business. At other times service might've been a little slow but they were busy and still very nice.
author: Kristine S.

description: Fantastic, flavorful food at great prices in a trendy environment. The wait staff is friendly and accommodating. Whether you come for the great beers, $2 tacos on Wednesdays, or the heaping plate of black beans, plantains, and crema- you're in for a treat.
author: Cassie P.

description: I just love this place- the food is so fresh, and their happy hour is wonderful. Great vibe and Esthela was the absolute best. Highly recommend!
author: Mike P.

description: The ceviche was incredibly fresh, and the mole was amazing! Great service and a definite place to return to. Can't wait to come back!
author: Hannah H.

description: Sat down for a quick drink on a Friday night while waiting for our dinner reservations around the corner. Service is friendly, lots of tv's (great for game days, I'm sure), and if you write a Yelp review, you get a free glass of sangria!! We also ordered some guac to tide us over until dinner. It definitely hit the spot.
author: Teresa C.

description: First restaurant I came to eat here in San Fran. Visiting from NYC. We had the carnitas tacos and the nachos and both meals were very satisfying. Everything tasted super fresh. Our server David is a sweetheart and very attentive. Will hopefully be coming back before my vacation is over. Thank you David!!!
author: Viviana E.

description: Good food, friendly service, excellent beer selection -- great alternative to Hi Tops if you want some space to relax and talk with friends. Go Warriors!
author: Cassie L.

description: Great service and amazing sangria! Recommend this place so much! Amazing!! I loved the taste of the sangria and the inside interior was thoughtfully placed! I enjoyed the location! Everyone should come and pre game here! Very classy
author: Jose J.

description: This place is great! Service is awesome, sangria is amazing and delicious fries :) chill place for your dayger!
author: Prachi G.

description: Looking for a quick lunch. Ran in here. Menu looked good. Had the Cubano. After time in miami I have pretty high standards, this one is def great - not perfect, but great ;) good beer selection and the sangria is awesome. Super friendly bartender too. Overall would come back. Amazed I used to live a block away and never came here.
author: Dominic C.

description: On my 1st trip to market Street here in San Francisco the drinks are awesome the beer is the best yaaaaasssss definitely recommend it for everyone
author: Jorge R.

description: Amazing food and amazing people, plus bottomless mimosas without the crazy lines!! This place also just looks super cool! I'm def. coming back here.
author: Shay E.

description: Had the nachos and they were amazing! Add the carne asada for an extra 3 bucks. The other thing that will make me come back is the staff. Super friendly and attentive. Especially Carlos. I'll be requesting him the next time I'm in town.
author: Cesar S.

description: Love this place.. Best service ever..  Fast and friendly... I would recommend thIs place with no doubt...
author: EL Sancho R.

description: The staff and food here was phenomenal. Came here for brunch on a Sunday and although it was busy, the staff was very quick and caring. We got the California omelet and split it between two people and it was plenty of food and very tasty! Very pleased with my visit and would definitely come back!
author: Cody M.

description: Came here to watch the Warriors game. The crowd was fun, food is delicious, and the service is top notch.
author: Bernex R.

description:
Ok so this space is just got bad mojo i guess since not one place has lasted that long there since bad dage Cafe! But we tried this place yesterday and from the start it was a battle to like. Just like the noodle place that used to be Fork, you have to order then sit down and they bring you the food .. Hate that an why go out to eat if im doing the work for u .  Anyway we stood in line to order and because we had ?s about the menu the people behind us made us feel rushed and I no the two guys were not thrilled with ?s being ask when the line was long , I don't blame them but thats how your owners set it up ,not our fault.  So we placed our order and I did ask the guy how much for mimosas he said  like 9-13 for a glass which is a small glass or unlimited for 18 and i looked at him an said 18 really! i got a diet coke ! but they did bring the food hot and my taco was really good and they came by to make sure we were satisfied . Thank u guys that were there for doing your best it was really nice , but to the owners you should have waiters ,for the prices your offering ,im sorry its a great location you should make the best of it when there is so much around . 

just my 2 cents.
author: Randy M.

description: We stumbled in this place while waiting for our dinner reservation. Great service. No wait and got seated right away.  We only ordered the guacamole and it was delicious, love the sauce that came with it. Bonus point: free Sangria if you write a review!
author: Irene L.

description:
Food and service was great! 

Tacos, burrito, ceviche -- all delicious. 

Hot sauce was on point.
author: Gurpreet K.

description: My husband and I tried to have lunch here today and the place was empty.  We sat down at a table by the door and the officious waiter walked over and asked how many was in our party and we said 2.  He said we could not sit at the table and asked us to move to the other side of the restaurant to a less desirable table.  We ended up walking out and won't visit again.  They won't last and we walked by an hour later and there was a party of 2 sitting at the same table we were asked to vacate.  We ended up having an enjoyable meal with drinks at another restaurant so don't put yourself through this - it still wasn't full an hour later.  I hope they crash and burn like the 4 other restaurants that were there before them - Adios Republic!
author: Linda M.

description: What a lovely pleasant surprise.  This space has been so many different restaurants over the years, and I think this one is here to stay.  Excellent brunch options, lively crowd...very happy.
author: Justin F.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the Castro.  The menu is excellent (especially the tacos and sangria) but the real gem is the staff.  Oscar, David, Carlos, Stella, and Anna are the BEST.  They work really hard but they are having fun, they are always happy.  Go for the food, but come back for the people!
author: Gaylen T.

description: This place is AMAZING! Great tunes, the tacos are top notch and there is a good selection of brews. The Castro Republic definitely does the Castro vibe justice. Oh and the place is friggin BEAUTIFUL!
author: Kyle L.

description: My wonderful skin therapist brought me over here to try out this place! Excited about the lamb be chicken slider I just ordered!
author: Jhamaria A.

description: Every time I'm in town I stop in for my favorite carne asada burrito! It's a must. Also check out the quesadilla, they don't cut corners and it's cheesy and super good. What's best is I can enjoy my favorite brew while I wait. Friendly staff, great food and across the street from one of the best Castro bars. Score!!
author: Nolan A.

description: Mr. Carlos gave me an awesome and friendly service. The atmosphere is spacious and great to eat inside or out if you want to appreciate the outdoors. And it is amazing because it is close to all the bars.
author: Juan C. P.

description: The three of us all ordered different sandwiches -- all fine served with French fries.  The sandwiches were pretty good but the fries were unremarkable.  Who doesn't love fries? I rarely indulge so when I do I want to enjoy and savor them -- but not these.  They were big and fat, and unfortunately very disappointing.   If they could just figure out a way to improve their fries and make them more like the fries at super duper -- I would definitely come back.  I may return and order something other than a sandwich.  Just don't get the fries.
author: Kevin G.

description: Great place for a casual, relaxed breakfast. I had the huevos rancheros,  super tasty! Friendly and fast service.
author: Brent F.

description: This place is by far the worst restaurant in the Castro. Terrible and EXPENSIVE food and the most clueless service ever. The two dollar tacos taste like dog food. . Now I know why the place is always empty.. Disgusting and yes they do have infestation problems.
author: Manuel V.

description: We gave this place a try since it has been closed down who knows how many times. Still bad service, over priced, and the food quality is poor. Walk a block for something better.
author: Drew W.

description: Really enjoyed my Sunday brunch here. Very good huevos rancheros and really nice staff. As of right now, its not yet discovered / mobbed .. Walked right in and got sat down. Seems like a good spot maybe to work for a bit ad well.
author: Daniel W.

description: Amazing. The spinach papaya salad (added grilled chicken) was huge and delicious. We went during a GSW game and it was packed but the food and sangria came fast. Best part = staff was extra sexy. Cheers.
author: l k.

description: My experience at this location was great Nice place good food those chilaquiles there so good ! The server Carlos was so friendly thank you Carlos and crew
author: Alex R.

description: I'm writing this review as I'm eating my Sopes Con Huevo. Oh em gee! This is soooo good! I felt like I was eating in Mexico City. The food reminded of this really good place called Primos in Colonia Roma. The staff is super friendly! I'm delighted! And the music is popping but not overwhelming. Awesome to listen to Aliyah while eating.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Awesome brunch!  Fantastic  service!! Loved the California omelette. Great place to people watch too.
author: Mike C.

description: These guys are so nice and the service is awesome. Food looks amazing and it's Latin food now which makes me happy.....White sangria is Hella bomb .....do yourself a favor and come hang out!
author: Cristal W.

description:
After playing at Brewcade I was hankering for some food. Saw this place across the street and had a nice "aura" to it (relaxed and not loud) so I decided to try it out. 

I ordered the carnitas burrito ($9.50, spicy of course) and a glass of water. Burrito is on the dry side, which is actually what I prefer. Not a big fan of soggy burritos, but they have house sauces that you can use for a little moisture. Carnitas meat is well cooked and seasoned moderately. Prices are fair and the inside decor is modern and clean.
author: David H.

description: Our 1st time here. It was recommended by restaurant nearby since they were not open for breakfast. Good size portions and very flavorful. Definitely coming back again.
author: Marty R.

description: Great new place to have brunch in the Castro. The food was amazing and the service was quick and very friendly. I had the chilaquiles with green sauce and it was delicious. We will certainly be going back to try the rest of their extensive menu.
author: Keith D.

description: I finally went here after walking past it again and again, not really getting the concept ... is it  a burger place or is it a taqueria?? Well it's both and  I wished I hadn't waited so long. Had the pollo adobo and carnitas tacos with a white sangria. Everything was tasty and perfectly cooked and plated. Sangria was nice and dry. Maybe a little more variety of fruit would have been nice but necessary. Want to try some of the sliders when I go back.
author: Ken B.

description: On vacation in San Francisco stopped  in to the castro republic for brunch the cubano sandwhich and the tacos were so good. I recommend coming here
author: Alex S.

description: Very friendly staff and delicious food. You can never go wrong with Bottomless mimosas! All the food was prepared fresh and full of flavor. Would definitely recommend!
author: Samantha H.

description: I love this place. I live around the corner and come as often as I can. The food is out of this world and the service is fantastic. Everyone should go drink here and eat here. The best!!!!
author: Tim D.

description: Not bad, not great. $6.75 is a bit much for a slider. If you're going to live in San Francisco you have to pay to play. But $30-$40 for lunch for two is a bit much. Much better options in the neighborhood at that price point. I wish them well as they seem like nice guys. Probably not a repeat spot.
author: Joe S.

description: Came here for brunch as an alternative to the busier Castro spots. Very chill place and huge menu!
author: Shayaan N.

description: Free sangria for a Yelp review, but that isn't the only reason I'm giving five stars. Food was incredible and inexpensive for the location. Restaurant was clean and the manager, Oscar, was personable, helpful, and guapo :p
author: Nick N.

description: I stumbled upon this dope spot while I was looking for Ike's. The nachos are amazing, the staff is ultra friendly, and the space is chill. Definitely recommend
author: Brian C.

description: Dog friendly,outside seating. Food came quick and presentation was nice. Ice tea good.
author: Autumn C.

description: Love this place... Every time I come in town I eat here for breakfast lunch or dinner... Great place and the hot Latino waiter keeps me coming back
author: Terry D.

description:
The waiters are so sweet and kind- they make you feel at home. The food is very good as well- made with love. 
It's the second time we stopped by for a bite and it was great. I rarely write a Yelp review - this place deserves it.
author: Jeffrey E.

description:
The people who work there are very nice and I hope the place does well, but the food and the environment just aren't what I think they should be to flourish long-term in a city like San Francisco. The Republic is okay, but just okay and far from great. 

I ordered the chilaquiles with chorizo and beans as a side and my wife ordered a chicken sandwich (I forget which one, but it looked and tasted just like a regular chicken sandwich) with a salad as a side. Nothing special on both accounts.  Also, the environment came across as cold and somewhat sterile, lacking the color and vibrancy for which the Latin American culture is known. I left thinking - "What did that place stand for?" and "I hope they last for a while because the staff seems nice."
author: Rocky B.

description:
I love this place. I have been there three times in the last 5 weeks. I have tried many of their items on the menu and found all to be delicious.  Today, I had the Verde Benedict...mushrooms, spinach, red peppers with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. I think this is now my favorite. 

Service was great, as it has been from all 3 guys who work there. I am assuming one of them is the business owner.  It was extremely busy and they were a little short staffed for the rush; however, they kept up a good pace, smiled and continued to give excellent service.

I will be there gain next weekend to try something different on the menu, before I head back home to San Diego.  If I could only get them to open up another Castro Republic down in SD
author: Gary C.

description: Stumbled on this place after parking around the corner. Lovely decor, fantastic service and amazing brunch! We will definitely be back for more of their chorizo eggs.
author: Sacha F.

description: The Cobb salad was on point! Carlos was my server and was super rad! The beer selection was struggling a little (but they did have lagunitas) :-p I'll be back
author: Jeffery S.

description: topping off our meal of mushroom tacos and poached eggs, our server brought the best platanos we ever had! This awesome place has a great sun spot for groups to enjoy in the morning... Server realized his own mistake on my Cappuccino order (he brought a regular coffee instead) but i could not accept his offer to send it back because the fancy creamer was so cute. Great food and quality service combine for a wonderful experience!
author: Ati C.

description: Taco Wednesday was great! Tacos and Sangria are on point! Great service too! David is the best ;)
author: Greg M.

description: This place has great tacos and great sangria. Have an awesome Taco Wednesday deal. Super nice staff too!
author: Tom C.

description: Omg if you want Mexican food in the Castro, this is it! The food is great and the service is even better. I totally recommend the pollo asado burrito; it is the bomb!
author: Brandon Z.

description: The food is great especially the truffle fries! Awesome servers! Castro sliders are delicious, and holy wow their burritos are huge and they totally hook it up. Views are great and people are friendly.
author: Britt H.

description: Finally! A good restaurant in this space! The food is delicious and service is great. The menu has tons of good breakfast and lunch/dinner options. The scrambled egg tacos are great and so are the carnitas. I'm looking forward to trying done if the sandwiches.
author: Melissa M.

description: This place has great customer service, reasonably priced drinks, outside seating, and amazing atmosphere! Check it out, you won't regret it!
author: Colleen K.

description: Taco Wednesday is the best! Great $2 tacos and guac comes with salsa which is cool. The sangria is really good but you don't get a free one with a yelp review on Wednesdays which is a bummer but oh well they were half price anyway .. and we ended up getting a free taco somehow! Sitting outside under the heat lamps on market is nice. Overall good experience, tasty food.
author: Corinne R.

description: This place is awesome! I came in with a large party without a reservation and they seated us promptly. They have a great taco selection as the service is great. Definitely recommend it!
author: Hannah S.

description: Great  food for brunch and great tacos. There's also a taco Wednesday special that's great for a hangout spot highly recommend
author: John S.

description: Excellent Sangria! This place is well located and beautiful and has the best Mexican food ever. Must try.
author: Astha P.

description: A great location, very convenient. I stopped in for a quick bite and was very impressed with their tacos! Great service, good food
author: Jimmy D.

description: This is the best restaurant this location has seen since it's changed owners more than 4x. I came on a Wednesday and discovered $2 tacos and $4 sangria. The mole tacos and the carnitas taco I had was delicious. White sangria was amaze. Great service! Will definitely be back to support and hope this one lasts
author: Ryan B.

description: Had a wonderful late morning brunch- very clean, fresh food and drinks! Chilaquiles were great, especially with the peach mimosas and large slices of fruit to go with them ($6 or unlimited for $19). The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would come back here for sure.
author: Hayden S.

description: I was walking by and the interior caught my eye...and I was so not disappointed! Tacos were awesome and Oscar & David, behind the bar, made for lovely hosting and conversation. Would definitely recommend for a good atmosphere.
author: Colleen D.

description: I love the food here! Great service and has that rustic cool vibe. I will be back ! The kitchen is always a deal breaker. Clean and maintained well. I will be back!!!!
author: Justin L.

description: Republic Republic, I'm hooked. I had there Verde eggs Benedict today, one word, delicious!!
author: La Toya R.

description: Amazing food!!! The mole and ceviche are to die for! Highly highly recommended place! Also staff is super sweet!
author: Sydney Z.

description: Their food just wasn't tasty enough to get more than 2 stars.  We had the pork burrito and chicken tenders.  Both were below average tasty and bland.  The chicken was dried and gave a bad after taste.  Not sure how their ratings are that high.
author: Ray C.

description: This place is absolutely unreal. The food is amazing, the service is everything you can ask for, decor is warm and provides an air of a classic SF affair. The people who work here are also really nice, awesome and super trendy!!
author: Dashiell P.

description: everything about this place is YES. happened to come here on a wednesday and the tacos are great. they're kinda small BUT i've had many mediocre tacos in my life that were a lot bigger and didn't taste as good. i'm happy to pay a little extra for tacos that will be flavorful and satisfy my cravings. our waiter was really friendly and i'll definitely be coming back. taco wednesday is my new thing now!
author: Alyssa L.

description: Came here for Taco Wednesday and tried the chicken adobo, hongos, and mole tacos and they were all great. Only $2 for the tacos. Also, both red and white sangrias were $4. David, our waiter, was very friendly and attentive.
author: omar c.

description: The atmosphere in this restaurant is fun and cute! The staff are extremely friendly and their brunch menu is killer! I would suggest the California omelette with apply chicken sausage; it's always amazing!
author: Gabby P.

description: amazing atmosphere, especially for watching sports! workers are really nice and their selection of beer is pretty good! food was okay, but you get free sangria if you write a review! haha
author: Elena V.

description: Fun friendly place with many choices. Friendly staff and the food is delicious. Walk up and order which I usually don't care for but works here. Try the blood orange lemonade.
author: Kathryn C.

description: This place has a great location. Servers were fast and professional. Try their truffle fries out, they're heavenly!
author: Sean H.

description: Chicken Mole tacos are delicious! Great deal on tacos on wednesdays! :) Carlos is a wonderful server!
author: Byron R.

description: We stopped in here for brunch. The food was great and the mimosas were delicious. Would definitely recommend this place for brunch!
author: Laura S.

description: Is 6 stars possible? Has God herself descended upon this restaurant and blessed this food? One answer is "I wish" and one is "most definitely."
author: Dorothy K.

description: It was a little pricey for what you get. My sliders were really good but the french fries were awful. We tried the Crispy Fries but they seem like they had been frozen and re-fried. A few of the fries were crispy but mostly mealy and mushy. Overall not very much food for the price.
author: Gordon S.

description: Super nice waiter!! Empty on Mon night? Should of been a hint. Ok burritos, salad dressing tasteless. Pork sandwich too sweet! Good truffle fries. Good music. Again, nice waiter!
author: Aquilegia C.

description: Delicious. Had the Spicy Tinga Enchiladas. Good quality food. Great flavors. Will go back.
author: Christopher B.

description: Service at this restaurant is awful! I've been waiting for my order for over 30 minutes. It shouldn't take this long to scramble an egg. People seated after us received their food before we did. Still waiting....
author: Kelly M.

description: Excellent service and delicious food. Great location and even better servers... a truly superb experience.
author: Jordan W.

description: Nice convenient location. Meeting some friends here. Two of is had been here before and really like the tacos. We're here for brunch today. Order some drinks at the bar while we wait for our table. Our table's ready...
author: Paul F.

description: What is with this place? The location is incredible, and yet every incarnation of this restaurant is awful. The service is downright terrible, and the food is overpriced and meh.
author: Brooks M.

description: I love this restaurant, the ambiance feels great. They have a good buritto too.  I want to stop by every week. I've been here two consecutive weeks for the buritto. The server Eduardo serves pretty well, he's very nice then can handle a lot of customer.
author: Aristotle T.

description: Friendly staff, if hard to get a table on Taco Wednesday. The avocado tacos were great!
author: Jacob W.

description: Came in to watch copa america. Not too crowded or loud. Service is great and definitely amazing carnita tacos! This is a great spot if you just want to hang and be able to watch sports:)
author: Zahyra G.

description: Way overpriced for what you get, food tasted good it was just crazy expensive for sliders, fries, and beer.
author: Mackenzie B.

description: Serviceable brunch spot no worse than the Castro standard that is mediocre at best anywhere else. The salmon Benedict was drowning in a hollandaise that was one note, tart lemon. The Cuban sandwich was good but a bit bland. Service was stellar though. Super nice FOH. I might try again for lunch but unlikely.
author: Brent A.

description: The menu is extremely misleading and the bill will be way more than you expect it to be. Food is decent but the cost is not worth it.
author: amy f.

description: The chilaquiles are delicious!!! Staff very nice and accommodating. Great place to stop for a quick bev or catch up with an old friend.
author: Ryan P.

description: The staff is really wonderful! Bottomless mimosas hell yeah! Such a cute atmosphere. Great for brunch!
author: Brianna M.

description: This place is awesome!! The vibes are great and the service was amazing. Oscar was so accommodating with everything and the food was terrific. I highly recommend for a fun brunch/lunch place in the beautiful sunny Castro.
author: Ari H.

description: Nice space, great service, good beer list. Food looked good and they had the Warriors game on multiple screens. A+
author: E K.

description: The environment in this Castro bar and restaurant is fun and lively. The staff is extremely attentive and kind. Not a big fan of the sandwiches, but they have lots of delicious beers on tap and their fries are top-notch. Good for watching the game or having a drink with friends.
author: Josh S.

description: 5 stars for food. 4 honest portion tacos for $16. And a Taco salad for $10. Good beers. Carnitas were special.
author: Ethan P.

description: I got the chorizo and spinach burrito it was great! It's a nice atmosphere and good place to watch sports games.
author: Christina R.

description: Stumbled upon The Castro Republic while wandering through the neighborhood and was rewarded with great food and service. Oscar and David are awesome!!
author: Rachel R.

description: I live in the Castro. Have walked by this place and few times and decided to go with a friend. The food was good and the service we had was great. They post a menu on the door. If you can't afford it or don't want to pay for what they offer, don't go. There are many places nearby that are much more expensive and aren't that great. This was a nice surprise in a fantastic location.
author: Jesse H.
